info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 18 at 2:38PM MST until September 18 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of west central Arizona, including the following county, La Paz and southern California, including the following county, San Bernardino.
* WHEN...Until 415 PM MST /415 PM PDT/.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 238 PM MST /238 PM PDT/, The public reported washes flowing and between Holiday Harbor and Parker Dam in the advisory area due to heavy rain in thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buckskin Mountain Park and Parker Dam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MST /415 PM PDT/ THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: La Paz, AZ; San Bernardino, CA
